Submodules

mobspy.simulation module

Main MobsPy module. It stocks the Simulation class which is responsible for simulating a Model

class mobspy.simulation.Simulation(model, reactions=None, names=None, parameters=None, plot_parameters=None)

Bases: Experimental_Data_Holder

add_plot_params(*args, **kwargs)
compile(verbose: bool = True) → str | None

Compiler method that calls the Compiler class in the modules directory

Parameters:

verbose – (bool) = print or not the results of the compilation

compose_sbml()
configure_parameters(config)

Configure simulation parameters from json file or dictionary

Parameters:

file_name – (str) name of the json file

configure_plot_parameters(config)

Configure plot parameters from json file or dictionary

file_name – (str) name of the json file

classmethod event_compilation_error() → None
event_condition(trigger, delay=0)

Context manager for condition events. Called in “with Simulation.event_condition(trigger) :” format.

Parameters:

  • trigger – () condition that triggers the event when fulfilled

  • delay – (int, float, Quantity) time to wait before triggering the event once the trigger condition has been fulfilled

event_context_add(time, trigger)

Adds an event to the event context

Parameters:

  • trigger – () condition that triggers the event when fulfilled

  • time – (int, float, Quantity) time to wait before triggering the event once the trigger condition has been fulfilled

event_context_finish() → None

Removes the context in all meta-species and resets some varaiables. Called each time an event context is finished.

event_context_initiator()

Sets the context in all meta-species. Called each time an event context is initiated.

event_time(time)

Context manager for time events. Called in “with Simulation.event_time(time) :” format.

Parameters:

time – (int, float, Quantity) any time used

extract_plot_essentials(*species)

Extract essential information for plotting

Parameters:

species – (meta-species objects) meta-species objects to plot

Returns:

species_strings (str) = species strings to be plotted, self.results = data resulting from the simulation, self.plot_parameters (dict) = parameters for plotting

generate_antimony(compose: bool = False, model_name=None) → list[str]

Generates an string with an Antimony model from a respective MobsPy model :param compose: (bool) Join composite simulations into a single sbml :param model_name: (str) desired name of the model. If not supplied a random name will be chosen

generate_sbml(compose=False)

Generates sbmls strings from the current stored models in the simulation :param composes: (bool) Join composite simulations into a single sbml

Returns:

to_return (list of str) list of sbml files from all the simulations stored

classmethod is_simulation() → bool
parse_volume_name_for_antimony()
plot(*species)

Another way of calling plot_deterministic for simplicity

Parameters:

species – (str or meta-species objects) list of species to be plotted

plot_deterministic(*species)

Calls deterministic plot. See default_plots module in the plot_scripts directory

Parameters:

species – (str or meta-species objects) list of species to be plotted

plot_parametric(*species)
plot_raw(parameters_or_file, return_fig=False)

Calls raw plot. See default_plots module in the plot_scripts directory

Parameters:

parameters_or_file – json file name with plot parameter configuration or dictionary with plot parameter configuration

plot_stochastic(*species)

Calls stochastic plot. See default_plots module in the plot_scripts directory

Parameters:

species – (str or meta-species objects) list of species to be plotted

run(duration=None, volume=None, dimension=None, repetitions=None, level=None, simulation_method=None, rate_type=None, plot_type=None, start_time=None, r_tol=None, a_tol=None, seeds=None, step_size=None, jobs=None, unit_x=None, unit_y=None, output_concentration=None, output_event=None, output_file=None, save_data=None, plot_data=None) → None

runs the simulation, the arguments for this function can be set using the get item method or this way Parameters not set to run will override the previous parameters, causing the model to recompile Resulting data is found with the query Simulation_object.results

Parameters:

  • duration – (float) duration of a simulation

  • volume – (float) volume of the simulation - if none given 1 - liter is used

  • repetitions – (int) number of times to reapeat a simulation

  • level – (int) 0 - only error messages, 3 - errors, warnings, compilation info

  • simulation_method – (str) stochastic, deterministic, direct_method - simulation method

  • rate_type – (str) stochastic or deterministic - mass action kinetics or probability of encounter

  • plot_type – (str) stochastic-style MobsPy plot or deterministic-style MobsPy plot

  • start_time – (float) the simulation will only display data after the start time

  • r_tol – (float) relative tolerance - basiCO simulation parameter

  • a_tol – (float) absolute tolerance - basiCO simulation parameter

  • seeds – (list) list of seeds for stochastic simulation

  • step_size – (float) time step-size for simulation

  • jobs – (int) number of jobs to execute simulation

  • unit_x – (unit) unit of the time x-axis

  • unit_y – (unit) unit of the y-axis

  • output_concentration – (bool) outputs the concentration instead of counts - to be changed

  • output_event – (bool) exactly when an event happens, it adds the data point to the results

  • output_file – (str) name of the file

  • save_data – (bool) save data or not

  • plot_data – (bool) plot data or not

save_data(file=None)

Saves the simulation result data to a file in json format

Parameters:

file – (str) name of the file to save the data to. If none a default name is provided

set_from_json(file_name)

Set simulation parameters from json file

Parameters:

file_name – (str) name of the json file

classmethod set_job_number(params)

class mobspy.simulation.SimulationComposition(S1, S2)

Bases: object

add_plot_params(*args, **kwargs)
compile(verbose=True)
generate_antimony(compose=False, model_name=None) → list[str]

Generates a string with an Antimony model from a respective MobsPy model :param compose: (bool) Join composite simulations into a single sbml

generate_sbml(compose=False) → list[str]

Generates a string with an SBML model from a respective MobsPy model :param compose: (bool) Join composite simulations into a single sbml

classmethod is_simulation() → bool
plot(*species)
plot_deterministic(*species)
plot_raw(parameters_or_file)
plot_stochastic(*species)
run(duration=None, volume=None, dimension=None, repetitions=None, level=None, simulation_method=None, start_time=None, r_tol=None, a_tol=None, seeds=None, step_size=None, jobs=None, unit_x=None, unit_y=None, output_concentration=None, output_event=None, output_file=None, save_data=None, plot_data=None, rate_type=None, plot_type=None)

runs a concatenated simulation with multiple simulation objects summed Some inputs are different here, duration and volume must receive any iterable with the volume for each simulation

Parameters:

  • duration – (iterable) duration of a simulation

  • volume – (iterable) volume of the simulation - if none given 1 - liter is used

  • repetitions – (int) number of times to reapeat a simulation

  • level – (int) 0 - only error messages, 3 - errors, warnings, compilation info

  • simulation_method – (iterable) stochastic, deterministic, direct_method - simulation method

  • start_time – (float) the simulation will only display data after the start time

  • r_tol – (float) relative tolerance - basiCO simulation parameter

  • a_tol – (float) absolute tolerance - basiCO simulation parameter

  • seeds – (list) list of seeds for stochastic simulation

  • step_size – (float) time step-size for simulation

  • jobs – (int) number of jobs to execute simulation

  • unit_x – (unit) unit of the time x-axis

  • unit_y – (unit) unit of the y-axis

  • output_concentration – (bool) outputs the concentration instead of counts - to be changed

  • output_event – (bool) exactly when an event happens, it adds the data point to the results

  • output_file – (str) name of the file

  • save_data – (bool) save data or not

  • plot_data – (bool) plot data or not

  • rate_type – (str) stochastic or deterministic rate expression - mass action kinetic or prob. based

  • plot_type – (str) stochastic or deterministic - style of MobsPy plot
